item.title: RenXchange is Hiring!
item.description: Do you want to make a difference for RPI? Do you want to gain skills in fundraising, communication, and customer service? You’re in luck! RenXchange is hiring! Benefits include: convenient location at the DCC, competitive pay, a fun environment with other students, and flex scheduling. Spaces are limited – apply at https://app.smartsheet.com/b/form/5620f155c9d94a76977dc3806bb3584c. For more information contact Uzi…

item.title: Now Accepting Spring Applications for CSTEP!
item.description: The Collegiate Science & Technology Entry Program (CSTEP) is excited to announce that applications for the Spring semester are now open! CSTEP is an academic enrichment program designed to support New York State residents who are economically disadvantaged and pursuing careers in STEM or health-related fields.

item.title: Lean Green Belt Certification - register by 1/16 for discount
item.description: At the end of this month the Industrial Engineering Student Chapter will host the Lean Green Belt certification taught by MANE professor and Master Black Belt Dr. Ashish Ghosh! Lean Green Belt is a 3-day intensive course about Lean manufacturing, waste management, and engineering management. Any student is welcome to sign up! For a discounted price register by this Friday 1/16/26. Registration is open until the week of the course.

item.title: Help Stock the RPI STEP Food Pantry
item.description: RPI STEP is accepting donations to benefit our food pantry, which keeps our students full and focused when they attend programs on campus. Donate $10 or more before Friday, December 12 at 12 noon and you will be offered your choice of apple or pumpkin pie as a sign of our gratitude. Pies will be available for pick up at the J-Building on Dec. 19 & 20! To make a donation, please see the announcement! Monetary donations for the food pantry will be accepted through January 31.

item.description: Spring 2026 parking permits are now available! To sign up visit rpi.aimsparking.com. If you have any questions or need help, feel free to reach out to the Parking Office at 518-276-6616 or parking@rpi.edu - we’re happy to assist!

item.title: Beyond the Classroom with Andrew Morrison ’87: Preparing for Industry, Innovation, and Impact
item.description:
Sunday, February 1st, 5 p.m. - 9 p.m., Andrew Morrison, former President of the RPI Student Union and serial entrepreneur who has built multiple million-dollar companies, will offer winning strategies to the RPI community. Implement these strategies in a workshop that will help you make a professional brand, attract a dream career, or launch a business. Dinner will be served. You’ll acquire access to $25,000 in travel scholarships, secrets to securing positions, and pathways to RPI resources.

For information about sharing your news or events, or to change your subscription settings, visit morningmail.rpi.edu.
